messages.message:
Hi team,
I am trying to skip the services which don't talk to DB from turning down during deployment. The primary intuition is to not have nodes turn to zero or low number and save time spent on bringing nodes back up during undo turn down phase.
I've also added Sandbox test results in the PR description
PR: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/71364

how would we ensure when a new service starts talking with DB that it is turned down?

can we have an accept list of services that will not be turned down during deployment?

cc @jayapandian.ponraj @sudeep

> how would we ensure when a new service starts talking with DB that it is turned down?
This is an interim change.
We will modify this and instead of pre-defined list, we will use the same label `database` label filter to identify services which talk to DB and use it to get remaining services.
That way it would be consistent internally as we add/remove services.

Also to add by default any new service added will be turned down by default - unless its added to this exclude list. So even if a new service is added that speaks with DB it should be safe to have this exclude list.
